parameters.name: wallet
parameters.description: Wallet to get the app fees for

balances.description: An array of app fee balances across multiple currencies

chainId.description: Chain id of the currency to claim

recipient.description: The recipient of the claimed funds

steps.description: An array of steps detailing what needs to be done to claim

id.description: Unique identifier tied to the step

action.description: A call to action for the step

description.description: A short description of the step and what it entails

kind.description: The kind of step, for claims this will be `signature`

items.description: For claims, we'll always have a single `signature` step

status.description: Can either be complete or incomplete

depositEnabled.description: If the network supports depositing to this chain, e.g. allows this chain to be set as the destination chain

disabled.description: If relaying to and from this chain is disabled

partialDisableLimit.description: The value limit at which the chain is partially disabled, if 0, the chain is not partially disabled. i.e, 1000000000000000000 to designate 1 ETH max withdrawal/deposit

blockProductionLagging.description: If the chain is experiencing issues where blocks are lagging behind or not being produced

withdrawalFee.description: The fee in bps for withdrawing from this chain

depositFee.description: The fee in bps for depositing to this chain

surgeEnabled.description: If the chain has surge pricing enabled

featuredTokens.description: An array of featured erc20 currencies

erc20Currencies.description: An array of erc20 currencies that the chain supports

supportsPermit.description: If the erc20 currency supports permit via signature (EIP-2612)

withdrawalFee.description: The fee in bps for withdrawing from this chain

depositFee.description: The fee in bps for depositing to this chain

surgeEnabled.description: If the chain has surge pricing enabled

solverCurrencies.description: An array of currencies that the solver accepts directly as input

iconUrl.description: The URL to the chain icon

logoUrl.description: The URL to the chain logo

vmType.description: The type of VM the chain runs on

baseChainId.description: The chain id which the chain rolls up to. This is always set as Ethereum for L1 chains

statusMessage.description: If applicable, a status message for the chain

solverAddresses.description: An array of solver addresses in use on the chain. (Note that there is currently only one address in use per chain)

healthy.description: A boolean indicating if the chain is healthy (true) or not (false)

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: User address, when supplied returns user balance and max bridge amount

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Restricts the user balance and capacity to a particular currency when supplied with a currency address. Defaults to native currency

balance.description: Balance on the origin chain in the native or supplied currency

maxBridgeAmount.description: Maximum amount that the user can bridge after fees in the native or supplied currency

balance.description: Balance of the solver on the destination chain. Denoted in wei

capacityPerRequest.description: How much of the given currency is available to be bridged per bridge request. Denoted in wei

supportsExternalLiquidity.description: This denotes if the chain combination supports canonical plus bridging

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: User address, when supplied returns user balance and max bridge amount

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Restricts the user balance and capacity to a particular currency when supplied with a currency id. Defaults to the native currency of the destination chain.

balance.description: Balance on the origin chain in the native or supplied currency

maxBridgeAmount.description: Maximum amount that the user can bridge after fees in the native or supplied currency

fee.description: Total fee in the native or supplied currency for the bridge operation

balance.description: Balance of the solver on the destination chain. Denoted in wei

capacityPerRequest.description: How much of the given currency is available to be bridged per bridge request. Denoted in wei

supportsExternalLiquidity.description: This denotes if the chain combination supports canonical plus bridging

user.description: Address that is depositing funds on the origin chain and submitting transactions or signatures

recipient.description: Address that is receiving the funds on the destination chain, if not specified then this will default to the user address

amount.description: Amount to bridge as the base amount (can be switched to exact input using the dedicated flag), denoted in wei

appFees.description: App fees to be charged for execution

refundTo.description: Address to send the refund to in the case of failure, if not specified then the receipient address or user address is used

refundOnOrigin.description: Always refund on the origin chain in case of any issues

useExactInput.description: Enable this to use the exact input rather than exact output

useExternalLiquidity.description: Enable this to use canonical+ bridging, trading speed for more liquidity

useFallbacks.description: Enable this for specific fallback routes

useForwarder.description: Enable this to route payments via a forwarder contract. This contract will emit an event when receiving payments before forwarding to the solver. This is needed when depositing from a smart contract as the payment will be an internal transaction and detecting such a transaction requires obtaining the transaction traces.

usePermit.description: Enable this to use permit (eip3009), only works on supported currency such as usdc

steps.description: An array of steps detailing what needs to be done to bridge, steps includes multiple items of the same kind (signature, transaction, etc)

example.description: Deposit funds for executing the calls

id.description: Unique identifier tied to the step

action.description: A call to action for the step

description.description: A short description of the step and what it entails

kind.description: The kind of step, can either be a transaction or a signature. Transaction steps require submitting a transaction while signature steps require submitting a signature

items.description: While uncommon it is possible for steps to contain multiple items of the same kind (transaction/signature) grouped together that can be executed simultaneously.

status.description: Can either be complete or incomplete, this can be locally controlled once the step item is completed (depending on the kind) and the check object (if returned) has been verified. Once all step items are complete, the bridge is complete

check.description: Details an endpoint and a method you should poll to get confirmation, the endpoint should return a boolean success flag which can be used to determine if the step item is complete

endpoint.description: The endpoint to confirm that the step item was successfully completed

method.description: The REST method to access the endpoint

gas.description: Origin chain gas fee in wei

relayer.description: Combination of the relayerGas and relayerService to give you the full relayer fee in wei

relayerGas.description: Destination chain gas fee in wei

relayerService.description: Fee paid to the relay solver in wei, note that this value can be negative (which represents network rewards for moving in a direction that optimizes liquidity distribution)

relayerCurrency.description: The currency for all relayer fees (gas and service)

value.description: Amount that will be bridged in the estimated time

userBalance.description: The user's balance in the given currency on the origin chain

requiredToSolve.description: The minimum balance the user needs to have to bridge

user.description: Address that is depositing funds on the origin chain and submitting transactions or signatures

recipient.description: Address that is receiving the funds on the destination chain, if not specified then this will default to the user address

amount.description: Amount to bridge as the base amount (can be switched to exact input using the dedicated flag), denoted in wei

appFees.description: App fees to be charged for execution

refundTo.description: Address to send the refund to in the case of failure, if not specified then the receipient address or user address is used

refundOnOrigin.description: Always refund on the origin chain in case of any issues

useExactInput.description: Enable this to use the exact input rather than exact output

useExternalLiquidity.description: Enable this to use canonical+ bridging, trading speed for more liquidity

useFallbacks.description: Enable this for specific fallback routes

useForwarder.description: Enable this to route payments via a forwarder contract. This contract will emit an event when receiving payments before forwarding to the solver. This is needed when depositing from a smart contract as the payment will be an internal transaction and detecting such a transaction requires obtaining the transaction traces.

usePermit.description: Enable this to use permit (eip3009), only works on supported currency such as usdc

steps.description: An array of steps detailing what needs to be done to bridge, steps includes multiple items of the same kind (signature, transaction, etc)

example.description: Deposit funds for executing the calls

id.description: Unique identifier tied to the step

action.description: A call to action for the step

description.description: A short description of the step and what it entails

kind.description: The kind of step, can either be a transaction or a signature. Transaction steps require submitting a transaction while signature steps require submitting a signature

items.description: While uncommon it is possible for steps to contain multiple items of the same kind (transaction/signature) grouped together that can be executed simultaneously.

status.description: Can either be complete or incomplete, this can be locally controlled once the step item is completed (depending on the kind) and the check object (if returned) has been verified. Once all step items are complete, the bridge is complete

check.description: Details an endpoint and a method you should poll to get confirmation, the endpoint should return a boolean success flag which can be used to determine if the step item is complete

endpoint.description: The endpoint to confirm that the step item was successfully completed

method.description: The REST method to access the endpoint

relayer.description: Combination of the relayerGas and relayerService to give you the full relayer fee

relayerService.description: Fees paid to the relay solver, note that this value can be negative (which represents network rewards for moving in a direction that optimizes liquidity distribution)

app.description: Fees paid to the app. Currency will be the same as the relayer fee currency. This needs to be claimed later by the app owner and is not immediately distributed to the app

subsidized.description: The amount of fees for the request that are subsidized by the request sponsor. Does not include deposit origin gas unless it is a permit based deposit.

value.description: Amount that will be bridged in the estimated time

userBalance.description: The user's balance in the given currency on the origin chain

requiredToSolve.description: The minimum balance the user needs to have to bridge

This is needed when depositing from a smart contract as the payment will be an internal transaction and detecting such a transaction requires obtaining the transaction traces.

description.description: A short description of the step and what it entails

kind.description: The kind of step, can either be a transaction or a signature. Transaction steps require submitting a transaction while signature steps require submitting a signature

relayer.description: Combination of the relayerGas and relayerService to give you the full relayer fee

relayerService.description: Fees paid to the relay solver, note that this value can be negative (which represents network rewards for moving in a direction that optimizes liquidity distribution)

app.description: Fees paid to the app. Currency will be the same as the relayer fee currency. This needs to be claimed later by the app owner and is not immediately distributed to the app

user.description: Address that is depositing funds on the origin chain and submitting transactions or signatures

recipient.description: Address that is receiving the funds on the destination chain, if not specified then this will default to the user address

amount.description: Amount to swap as the base amount (can be switched to exact input/output using the dedicated flag), denoted in the smallest unit of the specified currency (e.g., wei for ETH)

tradeType.description: Whether to use the amount as the output or the input for the basis of the swap

refundTo.description: Address to send the refund to in the case of failure, if not specified then the recipient address or user address is used

refundOnOrigin.description: Always refund on the origin chain in case of any issues

useForwarder.description: Enable this to route payments via a forwarder contract. This contract will emit an event when receiving payments before forwarding to the solver. This is needed when depositing from a smart contract as the payment will be an internal transaction and detecting such a transaction requires obtaining the transaction traces.

useExternalLiquidity.description: Enable this to use canonical+ bridging, trading speed for more liquidity

useFallbacks.description: Enable this for specific fallback routes

usePermit.description: Enable this to use permit (eip3009) when bridging, only works on supported currency such as usdc

slippageTolerance.description: Slippage tolerance for the swap, if not specified then the slippage tolerance is automatically calculated to avoid front-running. This value is in basis points (1/100th of a percent), e.g. 50 for 0.5% slippage

recipient.description: Address that will receive the app fee, if not specified then the user address is used

fee.description: App fees to be charged for execution in basis points, e.g. 100 = 1%

items.description: App fees to be charged for execution

steps.description: An array of steps detailing what needs to be done to bridge, steps includes multiple items of the same kind (signature, transaction, etc)

example.description: Depositing funds to the relayer to execute the swap for USDC

id.description: Unique identifier tied to the step

action.description: A call to action for the step

description.description: A short description of the step and what it entails

kind.description: The kind of step, can either be a transaction or a signature. Transaction steps require submitting a transaction while signature steps require submitting a signature

requestId.description: A unique identifier for this step, tying all related transactions together

items.description: While uncommon it is possible for steps to contain multiple items of the same kind (transaction/signature) grouped together that can be executed simultaneously.

status.description: Can either be complete or incomplete, this can be locally controlled once the step item is completed (depending on the kind) and the check object (if returned) has been verified. Once all step items are complete, the bridge is complete

check.description: Details an endpoint and a method you should poll to get confirmation, the endpoint should return a boolean success flag which can be used to determine if the step item is complete

endpoint.description: The endpoint to confirm that the step item was successfully completed

method.description: The REST method to access the endpoint

relayer.description: Combination of the relayerGas and relayerService to give you the full relayer fee

relayerService.description: Fees paid to the relay solver, note that this value can be negative (which represents network rewards for moving in a direction that optimizes liquidity distribution)

app.description: Fees paid to the app. Currency will be the same as the relayer fee currency. This needs to be claimed later by the app owner and is not immediately distributed to the app

subsidized.description: The amount of fees for the request that are subsidized by the request sponsor. Does not include deposit origin gas unless it is a permit based deposit.

value.description: Amount that will be swapped in the estimated time

userBalance.description: The user's balance in the given currency on the origin chain

requiredToSolve.description: The minimum balance the user needs to have to swap

details.description: A summary of the swap and what the user should expect to happen given an input

operation.description: The operation that will be performed, possible options are send, swap, wrap, unwrap, bridge

userBalance.description: The user's balance in the given currency on the origin chain

sender.description: The address that deposited the funds

recipient.description: The address that will be receiving the swap output

totalImpact.description: The difference between the input and output values, including fees

swapImpact.description: The impact of the swap, not factoring in fees

rate.description: The swap rate which is equal to 1 input unit in the output unit, e.g. 1 USDC -> x ETH. This value can fluctuate based on gas and fees.

origin.description: The slippage tolerance on the origin chain swap

destination.description: The slippage tolerance on the destination chain swap

user.description: User address that will make the deposit on a given origin chain
User address that will make the deposit on a given origin chain

slippageTolerance.description: Slippage tolerance for the swap, if not specified then the slippage tolerance is automatically calculated to avoid front-running. This value is in basis points (1/100th of a percent), e.g. 50 for 0.5% slippage

steps.description: An array of steps detailing what needs to be done to bridge, steps includes multiple items of the same kind (signature, transaction, etc)

example.description: Depositing funds to the relayer to execute the swap for USDC

id.description: Unique identifier tied to the step

action.description: A call to action for the step

description.description: A short description of the step and what it entails

kind.description: The kind of step, can either be a transaction or a signature. Transaction steps require submitting a transaction while signature steps require submitting a signature

requestId.description: A unique identifier for this step, tying all related transactions together

items.description: While uncommon it is possible for steps to contain multiple items of the same kind (transaction/signature) grouped together that can be executed simultaneously.

status.description: Can either be complete or incomplete, this can be locally controlled once the step item is completed (depending on the kind) and the check object (if returned) has been verified. Once all step items are complete, the bridge is complete

check.description: Details an endpoint and a method you should poll to get confirmation, the endpoint should return a boolean success flag which can be used to determine if the step item is complete

endpoint.description: The endpoint to confirm that the step item was successfully completed

method.description: The REST method to access the endpoint

relayer.description: Combination of the relayerGas and relayerService to give you the full relayer fee

relayerService.description: Fees paid to the relay solver, note that this value can be negative (which represents network rewards for moving in a direction that optimizes liquidity distribution)

app.description: Fees paid to the app. Currency will be the same as the relayer fee currency. This needs to be claimed later by the app owner and is not immediately distributed to the app

subsidized.description: The amount of fees for the request that are subsidized by the request sponsor. Does not include deposit origin gas unless it is a permit based deposit.

value.description: Amount that will be swapped in the estimated time

userBalance.description: The user's balance in the given currency on the origin chain

requiredToSolve.description: The minimum balance the user needs to have to swap

details.description: A summary of the swap and what the user should expect to happen given an input

operation.description: The operation that will be performed, possible options are send, swap, wrap, unwrap, bridge

userBalance.description: The user's balance in the given currency on the origin chain

sender.description: The address that deposited the funds

recipient.description: The address that will be receiving the swap output

totalImpact.description: The difference between the input and output values, including fees

swapImpact.description: The impact of the swap, not factoring in fees

rate.description: The swap rate which is equal to 1 input unit in the output unit, e.g. 1 USDC -> x ETH. This value can fluctuate based on gas and fees.

origin.description: The slippage tolerance on the origin chain swap

destination.description: The slippage tolerance on the destination chain swap

kind.description: The kind of signature. This value is returned in the quote API steps body field. e.g eip3009

requestId.description: The requestId of the quote this permit signature applies to. Returned in the quote API steps body field.

api.description: The API value returned from the quote API steps body field.

user.description: Address that is depositing funds on the origin chain and submitting transactions or signatures

recipient.description: Address that is receiving the funds on the destination chain, if not specified then this will default to the user address

amount.description: Amount to swap as the base amount (can be switched to exact input/output using the dedicated flag), denoted in the smallest unit of the specified currency (e.g., wei for ETH)

tradeType.description: Whether to use the amount as the output or the input for the basis of the swap

txsGasLimit.description: Total gas limit for the destination chain call transactions

authorizationList.description: Authorization list for EIP-7702 transactions to be executed on destination chain

additionalData.description: Additional data needed for specific routes

userPublicKey.description: If the request originates from Bitcoin and the user is a P2SH address, the public key is needed to be able to generate the transaction data

refundTo.description: Address to send the refund to in the case of failure, if not specified then the recipient address or user address is used

refundOnOrigin.description: Always refund on the origin chain in case of any issues

topupGas.description: If set, the destination fill will include a gas topup to the recipient (only supported for EVM chains if the requested currency is not the gas currency on the destination chain)

topupGasAmount.description: The destination gas topup amount in USD decimal format, e.g 100000 = $1. topupGas is required to be enabled. Defaults to 2000000 ($2)

useReceiver.description: Enable this to route payments via a receiver contract. This contract will emit an event when receiving payments before forwarding to the solver. This is needed when depositing from a smart contract as the payment will be an internal transaction and detecting such a transaction requires obtaining the transaction traces.

enableTrueExactOutput.description: Enabling will send any swap surplus when doing exact output operations to the solver EOA, otherwise it will be swept to the recipient

protocolVersion.description: The protocol version to use for the quote (currently experimental, do not use in production)

explicitDeposit.description: Enable this to avoid direct transfers to the depository (only relevant for EVM and v2 protocol flow)

useExternalLiquidity.description: Enable this to use canonical+ bridging, trading speed for more liquidity

useFallbacks.description: Enable this for specific fallback routes

usePermit.description: Enable this to use permit (eip3009) when bridging, only works on supported currency such as usdc

useDepositAddress.description: Enable this to use a deposit address when bridging, in scenarios where calldata cannot be sent alongside the transaction. only works on native currency bridges.

slippageTolerance.description: Slippage tolerance for the swap, if not specified then the slippage tolerance is automatically calculated to avoid front-running. This value is in basis points (1/100th of a percent), e.g. 50 for 0.5% slippage

latePaymentSlippageTolerance.description: Slippage tolerance for destination gas in the event that the deposit occurs after the order deadline, and more gas is required for the solver to execute the destination transaction.

recipient.description: Address that will receive the app fee, if not specified then the user address is used

fee.description: App fees to be charged for execution in basis points, e.g. 100 = 1%

items.description: App fees to be charged for execution

gasLimitForDepositSpecifiedTxs.description: If the request involves specifying transactions to be executed during the deposit transaction, an explicit gas limit must be set when requesting the quote

forceSolverExecution.description: Force executing swap requests via the solver (by default, same-chain swap requests are self-executed)

subsidizeFees.description: If the sponsor should pay for the fees associated with the request. Includes gas topup amounts.

maxSubsidizationAmount.description: The max subsidization amount in USDC decimal format, e.g 1000000 = $1. subsidizeFees must be enabled. This amount is the threshhold where if its surpassed the entire request will not be subsidized at all.

includedSwapSources.description: Swap sources to include for swap routing.

excludedSwapSources.description: Swap sources to exclude for swap routing.

includedOriginSwapSources.description: Swap sources to include for swap routing on origin.

includedDestinationSwapSources.description: Swap sources to include for swap routing on destination.

originGasOverhead.description: The gas overhead for the origin chain, this is used to calculate the gas fee for the origin chain when the solver is executing a gasless transaction on the origin chain

depositFeePayer.description: The payer to be set for deposit transactions on solana. This account must have enough for fees and rent.

includeComputeUnitLimit.description: Whether to include compute unit limit instruction for solana origin requests.

overridePriceImpact.description: Whether to ignore price impact errors.

steps.description: An array of steps detailing what needs to be done to bridge, steps includes multiple items of the same kind (signature, transaction, etc)

example.description: Depositing funds to the relayer to execute the swap for USDC

id.description: Unique identifier tied to the step

action.description: A call to action for the step

description.description: A short description of the step and what it entails

kind.description: The kind of step, can either be a transaction or a signature. Transaction steps require submitting a transaction while signature steps require submitting a signature

requestId.description: A unique identifier for this step, tying all related transactions together

depositAddress.description: The deposit address for the bridge request

items.description: While uncommon it is possible for steps to contain multiple items of the same kind (transaction/signature) grouped together that can be executed simultaneously.

status.description: Can either be complete or incomplete, this can be locally controlled once the step item is completed (depending on the kind) and the check object (if returned) has been verified. Once all step items are complete, the bridge is complete

check.description: Details an endpoint and a method you should poll to get confirmation, the endpoint should return a boolean success flag which can be used to determine if the step item is complete

endpoint.description: The endpoint to confirm that the step item was successfully completed

method.description: The REST method to access the endpoint

relayer.description: Combination of the relayerGas and relayerService to give you the full relayer fee

relayerService.description: Fees paid to the relay solver, note that this value can be negative (which represents network rewards for moving in a direction that optimizes liquidity distribution)

app.description: Fees paid to the app. Currency will be the same as the relayer fee currency. This needs to be claimed later by the app owner and is not immediately distributed to the app

subsidized.description: The amount of fees for the request that are subsidized by the request sponsor. Does not include deposit origin gas unless it is a permit based deposit.

details.description: A summary of the swap and what the user should expect to happen given an input

operation.description: The operation that will be performed, possible options are send, swap, wrap, unwrap, bridge

sender.description: The address that deposited the funds

recipient.description: The address that will be receiving the swap output

totalImpact.description: The difference between the input and output values, including fees

swapImpact.description: The impact of the swap, not factoring in fees

swap.description: Cost to execute swap or bridge depending on available liquidity. This value can be negative (representing network rewards for improving liquidity distribution)

execution.description: Fees paid to cover transaction execution costs

app.description: Fees paid to the app. Currency will be the same as the relayer fee currency. This needs to be claimed later by the app owner and is not immediately distributed to the app

rate.description: The swap rate which is equal to 1 input unit in the output unit, e.g. 1 USDC -> x ETH. This value can fluctuate based on gas and fees.

origin.description: The slippage tolerance on the origin chain swap

destination.description: The slippage tolerance on the destination chain swap

userBalance.description: The user's balance in the given currency on the origin chain

fallbackType.description: The type of fallback route the request uses, if any

isFixedRate.description: Whether the rate for the quote is fixed or dynamic (swap on origin/destination)

origin.description: The route taken for the origin chain swap

destination.description: The route taken for the origin chain swap

paymentDetails.description: The details for the depository payment

chainId.description: The protocol chain id for the payment

user.description: Address that is depositing funds on the origin chain and submitting transactions or signatures

recipient.description: Address that is receiving the funds on the destination chain, if not specified then this will default to the user address

amount.description: Amount to swap as the base amount (can be switched to exact input/output using the dedicated flag), denoted in the smallest unit of the specified currency (e.g., wei for ETH)

tradeType.description: Whether to use the amount as the output or the input for the basis of the swap

refundTo.description: Address to send the refund to in the case of failure, if not specified then the recipient address or user address is used

refundOnOrigin.description: Always refund on the origin chain in case of any issues

useReceiver.description: Enable this to route payments via a receiver contract. This contract will emit an event when receiving payments before forwarding to the solver. This is needed when depositing from a smart contract as the payment will be an internal transaction and detecting such a transaction requires obtaining the transaction traces.

useExternalLiquidity.description: Enable this to use canonical+ bridging, trading speed for more liquidity

useFallbacks.description: Enable this for specific fallback routes

usePermit.description: Enable this to use permit (eip3009) when bridging, only works on supported currency such as usdc

useDepositAddress.description: Enable this to use a deposit address when bridging, in scenarios where calldata cannot be sent alongside the transaction. only works on native currency bridges.

slippageTolerance.description: Slippage tolerance for the swap, if not specified then the slippage tolerance is automatically calculated to avoid front-running. This value is in basis points (1/100th of a percent), e.g. 50 for 0.5% slippage

recipient.description: Address that will receive the app fee, if not specified then the user address is used

fee.description: App fees to be charged for execution in basis points, e.g. 100 = 1%

items.description: App fees to be charged for execution

relayer.description: Combination of the relayerGas and relayerService to give you the full relayer fee

relayerService.description: Fees paid to the relay solver, note that this value can be negative (which represents network rewards for moving in a direction that optimizes liquidity distribution)

app.description: Fees paid to the app. Currency will be the same as the relayer fee currency. This needs to be claimed later by the app owner and is not immediately distributed to the app

subsidized.description: The amount of fees for the request that are subsidized by the request sponsor. Does not include deposit origin gas unless it is a permit based deposit.

details.description: A summary of the swap and what the user should expect to happen given an input

operation.description: The operation that will be performed, possible options are send, swap, wrap, unwrap, bridge

sender.description: The address that deposited the funds

recipient.description: The address that will be receiving the swap output

totalImpact.description: The difference between the input and output values, including fees

swapImpact.description: The impact of the swap, not factoring in fees

rate.description: The swap rate which is equal to 1 input unit in the output unit, e.g. 1 USDC -> x ETH. This value can fluctuate based on gas and fees.

origin.description: The slippage tolerance on the origin chain swap

destination.description: The slippage tolerance on the destination chain swap

userBalance.description: The user's balance in the given currency on the origin chain

executionKind.description: The kind of gasless transaction to execute. Currently supported: rawCalls

data.description: Raw call parameters for the gasless transaction

chainId.description: Chain ID of the EVM network

to.description: Address of the contract to call

value.description: ETH value to send with the call (in wei)

authorizationList.description: Authorization list for EIP-7702 transactions to be executed on destination chain

executionOptions.description: Options related to gas fee sponsorship, app referrer and destination calls

referrer.description: The referrer of the app which is executing the gasless transaction

subsidizeFees.description: If the app should pay for the fees associated with the request

destinationChainExecutionData.description: Destination execution data for the gasless transaction

calls.description: Calls to be executed on the destination chain

authorizationList.description: Authorization list for EIP-7702 transactions to be executed on destination chain

requestId.description: The request ID of the gasless transaction to execute

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: Required API key for authentication. Contact the team for getting an API Key

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid input or simulation failure

schema.description: Bad Request - Invalid input or simulation failure

401.description: Unauthorized - Missing or invalid API key or referrer

schema.description: Unauthorized - Missing or invalid API key or referrer

requestId.description: The request ID of the request that needs to be fast filled

solverInputCurrencyAmount.description: The input currency amount that the solver receives on origin

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: Required API key for authentication. Contact the team for getting an API Key

200.description: Request was successful. It was either queued or found to be already executed.

schema.description: Request was successful. It was either queued or found to be already executed.

message.example: Request successfully queued for fast fill.

400.description: Bad Request - The request body contains invalid data.

schema.description: Bad Request - The request body contains invalid data.

error.example: Currency is required and could not be determined.

401.description: Unauthorized - Missing or invalid API key.

schema.description: Unauthorized - Missing or invalid API key.

403.description: Forbidden - Fast fill is not enabled for this API key.

schema.description: Forbidden - Fast fill is not enabled for this API key.

error.example: Forbidden: Fast fill is not enabled for this API key.

404.description: The requested requestId could not be found.

schema.description: The requested requestId could not be found.

409.description: Conflict - This request is already being processed.

schema.description: Conflict - This request is already being processed.

error.example: Conflict: This request is already being processed.

429.description: Too Many Requests - Fast Fill Threshold Reached.

schema.description: Too Many Requests - Fast Fill Threshold Reached.

error.example: Too Many Requests: Fast Fill Threshold Reached. Make a deposit to proceed.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: A unique id representing the execution in the Relay system. You can obtain this id from the requests api or the check object within the step items.

status.description: Note that fallback is returned in the case of a refund

time.description: The last timestamp the data was updated

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: A unique id representing the execution in the Relay system. You can obtain this id from the requests api or the check object within the step items.

updatedAt.description: The last timestamp the data was updated

status.description: Note that fallback is returned in the case of a refund

gas.description: Estimated gas cost required for execution, in wei

fixed.description: The fixed fee which is always added to execution, in wei

price.description: The dynamic fee which is a result of the chain and the amount, in wei

type.description: The type of transaction, always set to onchain

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: Get all requests for a single chain in either direction. Setting originChainId and/or destinationChainId will override this parameter.

status.description: Note that fallback is returned in the case of a refund

slippageTolerance.description: Slippage tolerance for the swap. This value is in basis points (1/100th of a percent), e.g. 50 for 0.5% slippage

gas.description: Estimated gas cost required for execution, in wei

fixed.description: The fixed fee which is always added to execution, in wei

price.description: The dynamic fee which is a result of the chain and the amount, in wei

gateway.description: The fee taken by the API gateway, in wei

type.description: The type of transaction, always set to onchain

origin.description: The route taken for the origin chain swap

destination.description: The route taken for the origin chain swap

type.description: The type of transaction, always set to onchain

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: Chain ID to get swap sources for

chainIds.description: Chain IDs to search for currencies

currencyId.description: ID to search for a currency group

tokens.description: List of token addresses, like: chainId:address

includeAllChains.description: Include all chains for a currency when filtering by chainId and address

useExternalSearch.description: Uses 3rd party API's to search for a token, in case relay does not have it indexed

depositAddressOnly.description: Returns only currencies supported with deposit address bridging
